paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: Median age at diagnosis was 42 years (30–75); all were affected individuals.
patients.phenotype: All had sensorimotor polyneuropathy, with some having additional symptoms.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Among patients with p.Val50Met mutation, the median age at diagnosis was 42 years (30–75).

individual_records.phenotype_details: ATTR-CM, 20% had ATTR-PN, and 40% carpal tunnel syndrome.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patients carrying p.Val142Ile mutation had a median age of 67 years (54–69) at diagnosis.

individual_records.phenotype_details: mixed phenotype of ATTR-CM and ATTR-PN.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient with p.Glu109Lys mutation was diagnosed by the age of 45 years and had a mixed phenotype of ATTR-CM and ATTR-PN.

functional_data.summary: The mutations identified in TTR were associated with clinical manifestations of amyloidosis.

variants.segregation_data: The variants segregate with disease in families as they are associated with clinical symptoms.
variants.additional_notes: All identified mutations were linked to clinical presentations of amyloidosis.
key_quotes: Thirteen patients had ATTRv, with the following mutations identified: p.Val50Met (54%; n = 7), p.Val142Ile (38%; n = 5), and p.Glu109Lys (8%; n = 1).

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text.
